person.persName: Hosea A. Pierson (Union County, Kentucky, minister, post master, merchant, and police judge.)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, minister, post master, merchant, and police judge. North Carolina native. Married to Elizabeth W. Young Pierson in Union County, Kentucky, on March 28, 1822. Father of A.L. Pierson, G.M. Pierson, A.J. Pierson, Martin V. Pierson, and Thomas B. Pierson. Married to Prudence C. Clore Pierson in Union County on February 5, 1859. Resident of Union County in 1840. Owned three enslaved persons in Union County in 1840. Minister in Union County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Postmaster for Cypress in Union County. Merchant in Union County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Union County in 1860.
